{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3545691,"name":"Nicholas Armstrong","username":"narmstro","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/5e9695/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-03T12:03:30.255Z","cooked":"

A trapezoidal profile has 2 constraints (max v and max A).

An exponential profile has max input (which you could tune). And kv, ka which comes from characterization of the mechanism.

Can kv, ka (or should they) be treated as tunable parameters like max V and A in a trap profile. Where the characterized values represent an extreme?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-03-03T12:03:30.255Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":224,"readers_count":223,"score":84.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":493970,"topic_slug":"exponential-profile-question","display_username":"Nicholas Armstrong","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48345,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/exponential-profile-question/493970/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3546034,"name":"Tyler Veness","username":"calcmogul","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/calcmogul/{size}/128045_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-03T16:53:18.167Z","cooked":"

kᵥ and kₐ aren’t state or input bound constraints. kᵥ has units of voltage applied per steady-state velocity, and kₐ has units of voltage applied per instantaneous acceleration from rest. They define the profile’s dynamics constraint.

    /**
     * Constructs constraints for an ExponentialProfile from characteristics.
     *
     * @param maxInput maximum unsigned input voltage
     * @param kV The velocity gain.
     * @param kA The acceleration gain.
     * @return The Constraints object.
     */
    public static Constraints fromCharacteristics(double maxInput, double kV, double kA) {
      return new Constraints(maxInput, -kV / kA, 1.0 / kA);
    }

    /**
     * Constructs constraints for an ExponentialProfile from State-Space parameters.
     *
     * @param maxInput maximum unsigned input voltage
     * @param A The State-Space 1x1 system matrix.
     * @param B The State-Space 1x1 input matrix.
     * @return The Constraints object.
     */
    public static Constraints fromStateSpace(double maxInput, double A, double B) {
      return new Constraints(maxInput, A, B);
    }

So I ask this primarily because I saw that CTRE"s implementation of this used different values for their feedforward and motion profiling configs on purpose.

So one could do this, but is that part of the intent?

Do what exactly? I haven’t seen CTRE’s API.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-03-03T18:10:45.430Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":126,"readers_count":125,"score":30.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":493970,"topic_slug":"exponential-profile-question","display_username":"Tyler Veness","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":48345,"username":"narmstro","name":"Nicholas Armstrong","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/5e9695/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16846,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib controls | Choreo optimizer backend"},"post_url":"/t/exponential-profile-question/493970/4","custom_user_title":"WPILib controls | Choreo optimizer backend","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3546212,"name":"Nicholas Armstrong","username":"narmstro","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/5e9695/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-03T18:24:34.250Z","cooked":"
Phoenix 6

Motion Magic® Controls

In addition to basic PID control, the Talon FX also supports onboard motion profiling using Motion Magic® controls. Motion Magic®: Motion Magic® is a control mode that provides the benefit of Motio...

// in init function
var talonFXConfigs = new TalonFXConfiguration();

// set slot 0 gains
var slot0Configs = talonFXConfigs.Slot0;
slot0Configs.kS = 0.25; // Add 0.25 V output to overcome static friction
slot0Configs.kV = 0.12; // A velocity target of 1 rps results in 0.12 V output
slot0Configs.kA = 0.01; // An acceleration of 1 rps/s requires 0.01 V output
slot0Configs.kP = 4.8; // A position error of 2.5 rotations results in 12 V output
slot0Configs.kI = 0; // no output for integrated error
slot0Configs.kD = 0.1; // A velocity error of 1 rps results in 0.1 V output

// set Motion Magic Expo settings
var motionMagicConfigs = talonFXConfigs.MotionMagic;
motionMagicConfigs.MotionMagicCruiseVelocity = 0; // Unlimited cruise velocity
motionMagicConfigs.MotionMagicExpo_kV = 0.12; // kV is around 0.12 V/rps
motionMagicConfigs.MotionMagicExpo_kA = 0.1; // Use a slower kA of 0.1 V/(rps/s)

m_talonFX.getConfigurator().apply(talonFXConfigs);
","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-03-03T18:24:34.250Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":116,"readers_count":115,"score":33.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":493970,"topic_slug":"exponential-profile-question","display_username":"Nicholas Armstrong","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://v6.docs.ctr-electronics.com/en/stable/docs/api-reference/device-specific/talonfx/motion-magic.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Motion Magic® Controls","clicks":4}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":16846,"username":"calcmogul","name":"Tyler Veness","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/calcmogul/{size}/128045_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48345,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/exponential-profile-question/493970/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3546221,"name":"Tyler Veness","username":"calcmogul","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/calcmogul/{size}/128045_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-03T18:28:47.774Z","cooked":"
narmstro:

Can kv, ka (or should they) be treated as tunable parameters like max V and A in a trap profile. Where the characterized values represent an extreme?

You can tune kᵥ and kₐ, but like I said before, they’re a different kind of constraint. They aren’t bound constraints like max velocity and max acceleration.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-03-03T18:29:21.106Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":96,"readers_count":95,"score":24.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":493970,"topic_slug":"exponential-profile-question","display_username":"Tyler Veness","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":48345,"username":"narmstro","name":"Nicholas Armstrong","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/5e9695/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16846,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib controls | Choreo optimizer backend"},"post_url":"/t/exponential-profile-question/493970/6","custom_user_title":"WPILib controls | Choreo optimizer backend","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3546290,"name":"Nicholas Armstrong","username":"narmstro","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/5e9695/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-03T19:02:55.191Z","cooked":"

@calcmogul
I gotcha now. Thanks for dedicating the time for this question.
Something I saw at a competition and then noticed on CTRE.

If I can bother you for just another second. We’ve been using this for an elevator this year as opposed to a trap profile (with REV not CTRE) and wondered if this was one of the reasons why we got a lot of banging on the return journey. The expo profile did have the feedforward current setpoint as current position (mistake on my part). Our traveling up and down is smoother than before, but is there something I should modify other than input voltage.

I lowered it to 4 just to reduce the downward banging.

I can send a code snippet in about an hour + a sysId run.
It was tuned with sysId and all of the usual FF and FB values.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-03-03T19:02:55.191Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":91,"readers_count":90,"score":23.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":493970,"topic_slug":"exponential-profile-question","display_username":"Nicholas Armstrong","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":16846,"username":"calcmogul","name":"Tyler Veness","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/calcmogul/{size}/128045_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48345,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/exponential-profile-question/493970/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3546295,"name":"Tyler Veness","username":"calcmogul","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/calcmogul/{size}/128045_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-03T19:05:19.090Z","cooked":"
narmstro:

and wondered if this was one of the reasons why we got a lot of banging on the return journey

The time domain plots of your setpoints, measurements, and control inputs should explain it. The typical values to plot are position setpoint, velocity setpoint, position measurement, velocity measurement, and voltage.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-03-03T19:06:08.762Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":81,"readers_count":80,"score":21.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":493970,"topic_slug":"exponential-profile-question","display_username":"Tyler Veness","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16846,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib controls | Choreo optimizer backend"},"post_url":"/t/exponential-profile-question/493970/8","custom_user_title":"WPILib controls | Choreo optimizer backend","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3546340,"name":"Nicholas Armstrong","username":"narmstro","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/5e9695/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-03T19:35:22.236Z","cooked":"

Okay. Not a problem. Looking specifically at the plots on sysId.

image1867×1072 282 KB

Here is the file. I had to make its extension a .txt
Elevator_FRC_20250225_214638.wpilog.txt (762.6 KB)

There is an arm attached to the elevator. It is also 2 stage, but I’m ignoring stage 2nd stage. This is all from the 1st stage’s perspective.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-03-03T19:36:18.508Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":72,"readers_count":71,"score":19.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":493970,"topic_slug":"exponential-profile-question","display_username":"Nicholas Armstrong","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"/uploads/short-url/3H37zVUTXcXCbqZYP9yqdN2FSD.txt","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":16846,"username":"calcmogul","name":"Tyler Veness","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/calcmogul/{size}/128045_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48345,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/exponential-profile-question/493970/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3546345,"name":"Tyler Veness","username":"calcmogul","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/calcmogul/{size}/128045_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-03T19:36:28.263Z","cooked":"

You sure that’s not backlash? The timescale on which it occurs is very small.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-03-03T19:36:28.263Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":69,"readers_count":68,"score":23.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":493970,"topic_slug":"exponential-profile-question","display_username":"Tyler Veness","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":48345,"username":"narmstro","name":"Nicholas Armstrong","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/5e9695/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16846,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib controls | Choreo optimizer backend"},"post_url":"/t/exponential-profile-question/493970/10","custom_user_title":"WPILib controls | Choreo optimizer backend","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3546358,"name":"Nicholas Armstrong","username":"narmstro","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/5e9695/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-03T19:38:39.089Z","cooked":"
narmstro:

slower kA of 0.1 V/(rps/s)

I mean after we made some fixes tour our code. This run made from the fixed version. We did notice a sizeable decrease. It could be backlash.
I assume you mean just shaky noise from the surround mechanisms that its attached.

Here is code snippet.

Using 2 vortexes.

I know there is a mistake here.

        goal.position = height.baseUnitMagnitude();
        goal.velocity = 0.0;
        ExponentialProfile.State next = positionProfile.calculate(profilePeriod.baseUnitMagnitude(), setpoint, goal);
        double currentVelocity = motor.getEncoder().getVelocity();
        double arbFeedfoward = feedforward.calculateWithVelocities(currentVelocity, next.velocity);
        motor.getClosedLoopController().setReference(next.position, SparkBase.ControlType.kPosition, kSlot0, arbFeedfoward, SparkClosedLoopController.ArbFFUnits.kVoltage);
        setpoint = next;

I’m probably also going to not use the units class. Mixing WPI FF with REV FB

The noise is not prolonged. Very short. Less than a second. If its unavoidable that’s understandable. I just didn’t have a feel for it going from code to reality.

A few recommendations to try and resolve this:

  • Does the elevator do this behavior if you give it a fixed voltage instead of the profile? Try running sysid briefly without hitting any of the travel limits of the elevator.
  • Log the variables mentioned previously and look at these plots. Use Network tables and advantage scope
  • Try setting kA to 0 for the feed forward, but keep it for the profile. See how that runs, or tune without the feed forward kA first.
